p: An ideal anticancer drug causes death or disability of the cancer cell while not harming normal cells ( Taraphdar, 2001). Since the disruption ofthe cell cycle plays an important role in cancer progression, its modulation is attracting great attention. A number of herbs with the ability to induce cell cycle arrest can be effective in preventing and treating cancer. Growing of breast cancer involves activation and deactivation of several types of genes ( Ingvarsson, 2001). Wild type p53 is an important regulatory protein in induction of apoptosis after DNA damage induced by anti-cancer drugs. The Bcl-2 is a gene that halts initiation steps of apoptosis and programmed cellular death ( Gasco et al., 2003; Krajewski et al., 1999).
